reviews.review: It's fun and funny.

Probably one of the most well created games of all time.  I love Valve and all their titles but this one is just magnificent.  If you played Portal 1 and liked it or thought it was just okay, you MUST play this.  At the end of the game you feel very accompllished that you completed it.  There is no replay value but that doesn't matter as its one of the most enjoyable singleplayer and coop games I've played in a while.
One of the best games you'll ever play!
Comedy, Action, and requires thought..  its an all around good time.

I absolutely love this game. I love GLaDOS' commentary, which many would agree, and the small hint towards Half-Life 2 (Black Mesa) that Cave Johnson says in one of the levels. I also love the installation of Wheatly, and, just like the first Portal, the air of mystery behind Aperture Laboratories that nobody seems to know.

if you dont have it already u need to get it
Amazing. There is just no other word to explain it.
Get. This. Game.
Portal but on steroids. With all new features, crazy challenges, that will leave you thinking for ever... especially in Co-op mode which is absolutley brilliant from start to finish

Awesome game. Even now... many years after it's release. If you haven't already, buy it! The single player campaign (puzzle series) is great, challenging, and progresses logically. Wheatley is funny as hell and GlaDOS is her usual brutally cold self. But this game really, really shines in multiplayer. The addition of a second player allows the two of you to cooperatively create and use four portals at a time and turns the puzzles into something much more than when it's just you alone. Get it and get a copy for a friend so you can explore this game together.
And after you think you're all done, go to the workshop and get some of the best community maps. The Portal 2 community mappers have extended the playability of this game to infinity.

I loved it. The co-op play definitely requires voice comms to get together on a plan.
**** The best beer & pretzels with a buddy game there is ****
It is good, play this game.  Or not, that's cool too.
It's fun.
If you're my friend you are already playing this game.  If you aren't, you are not my friend.

One of the best selling puzzle games out there. Portal 2  gives you an exciting singleplayer experience with enjoyable characters and character developments. Unlike the original game, there's now a co-op mode so you could enjoy solving puzzles for GaldOS with your friends.

Although the replayability seems weak, Valve promised a DLC release soon for summer 2011. There will be new test chambers, a challenge mode for single and co-op, and a leaderboard for you to compete with your friends. Portal 2 isn't for everybody, but it's damn near for a game of the year award for 2011. I have no doubts that  it will be.
Chell's awake, GLaDOS is back online, and there'll be hell to pay.

[Part Two of Two]

Graphics are unique to both games, you will find clean and sterile enviroments mixed with dangerous out of bounds scenery in the first and well, an overpowering, overwhelming sense of scale and enviroment in the second game. You will come across so called Rat Den's in both and I suggest you take the time to find and explore them as they contain images which makes this game so unique.

Story is simple, make portals, solve puzzles, continue. This is for the first game, the second, without too many spoilers, is more about survival as well as solving puzzles. You will always be challenged and once sucked in, there's no escape. Hope GLaDOS approves of your testing ability.

All in all, both games are totally worth it and one doesn't go without the other. You just have to have gone through number one to understand the complexity and awesome number two. Oh, number two has Co-Op, have fun with you science partner! 

FInal Rating:
Portal 1 - 4 / 5
Portal 2 - 4.5 / 5

It's one of my all time favourites and absolutely a game I recommend whenever I can.

The story isnt too original but entertaining nonetheless and the monologues are pretty funny.

A worthy sequal to the original. Plenty of moments that will make you feel smarter, hilarious dialog, co-op so you can bring a friend, family member, or significant other along, and for new players, is really easy to get into. Portal 2 is one of the best games ever made.
Great game, great graphics, and overall awesome story. It's a MUST BUY for Valve fans.

Portal 2 has a much more indepth storyline compared to the 1st portal game and it features nice elements like they had in Half-Life2 where you could look around and discover things which would make you think more about whats been going on.

There is more dialogue between the characters that I doubt I heard it all on my 1st playthrough and although the challenges don't seem as hard as the 1st game.. they defiantly make you think outside the box.

- Portal 2 has coop which comes with atleast 5 sections to complete; which took a fair amount of time to complete.
(I look forward to any additional maps if any are released like the 1st portal)

Is there enough good things to say about Portal 2?
Valve pushed the gaming industry ahead by crafting a geniunely funny game. It breaks the time weathered mold of "funny... for a video game" and has as many quirky robots to keep up with a Pixar movie. The puzzles are smart, and make you feel smart. And the timing is always spot on.  More studios need the talented writing staff that Valve sports.
Best game of 2011.  BUY BUY BUY!
So moist.
One of the greatest game ever to be made. Yup, that much.
Hours of fun trying to solve puzzles with buddies while drunk.
Amazing game, Valve really know how to impress. Funny, sexy, action packed, great fun!
its like a whole bottle of awesome sauce!!!
An excellent sequel, one of the funniest game I've played in years.

THIS is what video games are meant to be : providing a memorable experience which is absolutely flawless from the beginning to the end. This game makes you feel smart. This game makes you want more. This game makes you laugh. This game makes you love video games.

パズルFPS「Portal」の続編。先に前作をプレイすることを強く推奨する。ストーリー的にも一応繋がっていることになっている(前作ラストからの繋がりが実はよく分からなかったが)。前作のルールに新たな要素をいくつか追加したもので、パズルゲームとしては拡張版に近い。グラフィック面はかなり向上していると感じられ、広い空間の描写が多いため十分に発揮されていると思う。ストーリー面はかなり良く出来ており、サプライズも十分にあると思った。パズルの難易度をある程度犠牲にした部分はあるが、その分緊張感や没入感は全体的に上がっていると思う。co-opは初見でしか楽しめないらしく、友人と一緒に遊ぶのが吉か。

Genial. El Portal fue un regalo el cual mucha gente, incluido yo, pensaba que seria un juego corto y no tendría nada de diversión y nos equivocamos en la parte de nada de diversión.

Han aprovechado al máximo la historia del Portal en Portal 2, han incluido nuevos elementos que lo hacen mucho mas adictivo y entretenido y se hace corto pero realmente es mas largo que el primero.

Sin duda hay que tenerlo, pero si no has jugado Portal 1 es muy recomendable para seguir la trama, pero no indispensable.

Portal 2 is easily one of the most entertaining games of the year, full points should be awarded for quality consistency, and another set of points for pure comedy value. Portal 2 churns out more quality and hilarity more frequently than Activision can process production teams to make new Call of Duty games.

If you do not get this game, then you will never have true happiness.

Fun fact: 150% of couples that participated in cooperative portal testing are still deeply in love today.

Portal 2 is probably one of my favorite games of all time. The writing of the game is phenomenal, not just in the hilarious writing, but in the environment as well. As the levels change themes throughout the game, going from dilapidated and plant filled, to clean and shiny, to a 60''s abandoned feel, the world is full of character.

The storyline of the game truly shocked me. I did not expect to feel any remorse or guilt for my actions. While the main character may be mute, in no way is she characterless. The actions you undertake have a permanent mark on the facility. By the end of the game, there is no room for a Portal 3.

And the puzzles. They are paced fantastically. With the exception of one chamber, I never felt like I needed a guide to solve them. While on the other side, even early on, I had to think through what I had to do quite often.

If you liked Portal 1 in the slightest amount, then get this game. You will not regret it.
Buy it its a good game
